original_title: SEC and CFA Society Sri Lanka join hands in MOU renewal
original_body_lines: The Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka (SEC) and CFA Society Sri Lanka are pleased to announce the successful renewal of their Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), signifying a strengthened commitment to fostering the development of the capital market in Sri Lanka.

On the occasion of signing the MoU, Faizal Saliah, chairman of SEC, noted: “The SEC is pleased to continue our collaboration with CFA Society Sri Lanka through the renewal of this MOU. Together, we aim to drive improvements in the capital market and enhance market integrity, and transparency, as well as promote the adoption of the highest standards and practices within the investment industry.”
Aruna Perera CFA, President of CFASL, also expressed his enthusiasm for the partnership and the potential it holds for the capital market of Sri Lanka.

“CFA Society Sri Lanka is delighted to sign this MOU with the SEC. We firmly believe in the power of collective efforts to achieve positive outcomes. By working together, we can contribute significantly to the growth and development of Sri Lanka’s capital market, fostering an environment of trust and excellence.”

The collaboration between the SEC and CFA Society Sri Lanka will serve as a catalyst for strengthening investor confidence, supporting sustainable economic growth, and elevating the overall financial landscape of the nation.

Both organizations are committed to implementing joint initiatives, conducting research, and organizing educational programs that will further empower market participants with the knowledge and expertise needed to navigate the evolving financial landscape successfully.
With a shared vision and mutual dedication to advancing the capital market, this renewed partnership promises to shape a more robust and prosperous financial future for Sri Lanka.
